alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 4:38AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Niceville, Eglin AFB, Valparaiso, Lake Lorraine, Ocean City, Shalimar, Cinco Bayou, Eglin Village, Longwood and Postil. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
